entry.title: Iraq SMS Carrier Maintenance - Multiple Networks
entry.summary:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Aug 21, 18:00 PDT - Aug 28, 22:00 PDT Aug 21, 07:56 PDT Scheduled - Multiple Networks in Iraq is conducting a series of planned maintenances from 21 August 2023 at 18:00 PDT until 28 August 2023 at 22:00 PDT. During the maintenance window, there could be intermittent delays delivering SMS to multiple networks Iraq handsets.
Note, the maintenance will be carried out on each of the following dates and times:
21 August 2023 at 18:00 PDT until 21 August 2023 at 22:00 PDT 22 August 2023 at 18:00 PDT until 22 August 2023 at 22:00 PDT 23 August 2023 at 18:00 PDT until 23 August 2023 at 22:00 PDT 25 August 2023 at 18:00 PDT until 25 August 2023 at 22:00 PDT 26 August 2023 at 18:00 PDT until 26 August 2023 at 22:00 PDT 27 August 2023 at 18:00 PDT until 27 August 2023 at 22:00 PDT 28 August 2023 at 18:00 PDT until 28 August 2023 at 22:00 PDT

entry.title: Super SIM Connection Event Delays

Aug 21, 14:41 PDT Monitoring - Our engineering team has put in a fix to address the issue that is causing delays in Super SIM Connection Events. We will continue to monitor. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available. Aug 21, 12:55 PDT Identified - The issue causing delays in Super SIM Connection Events has been identified. The team deployed new service instances to mitigate the impact and devices reconnecting after 18:58 UTC will not encounter delays. Existing connections are being transferred to the newly deployed instances. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available. Aug 21, 11:59 PDT Update - Since 12:00 PM UTC we started investigating an issue where users Super SIM may experience delayed in getting their Super SIM Connection Events. Device connectivity to the mobile networks is not impacted. We are actively working to identify and resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available. Aug 21, 11:43 PDT Investigating - Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super SIM Connection Events. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

entry.title: Incident: Users may be having trouble loading Slack.
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On August 21, 2023 from 8:00 AM PDT to 8:51 AM PDT, less than 1% of users experienced trouble loading Slack.
We determined that a recent code change on our back end was resulting in a higher than expected memory footprint, and that this combined with high traffic loads was causing these issues.
We immediately rolled back this change, which resolved the issue for all affected users.

entry.title: RESOLVED: We are experiencing an issue with multiple products of Google Workspace including Gmail, Google Docs, Google Drive Our engineering team continues to investigate the issue. We will provide an update by Thursday, 2023-08-17 15:00 US/Pacific with current details. We apologize to all who are affected by the disruption.
entry.summary:
Incident began at 2023-08-17 19:56 and ended at 2023-08-17 23:09 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Mini Incident Report

We would like to provide some information about this incident below. Please note, this information is based on our best knowledge at the time of posting and is subject to change as our investigation continues. If you have experienced an impact outside of what is listed below, please reach out to Google Workspace Support using the help article https://support.google.com/a/answer/1047213.

(All Times US/Pacific)

Incident Start: 17 August 2023 at 12:56

Incident End: 17 August 2023 at 16:09

Duration: 3 hours, 13 minutes

Affected Services and Features:

Gmail, Google Docs, Google Drive

Regions/Zones: Brazil

Description:

Multiple products of Google Workspace including Gmail, Google Docs and Google Drive were intermittently unavailable for users of Brazil for a period of 3 hours and 13 minutes. Upon further investigation, Google Engineers confirmed that the issue was pertaining to Brazilian Internet Service Providers (ISPs) , and was not caused by any of the Google services.

Customer Impact:

Users may have observed instability and intermittent issues in accessing the services of Gmail, Google Docs and Google Drive, including errors in loading pages, and opening attachments from emails.

Affected products: Google Docs

entry.title: Outage: Trouble loading Slack
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On August 17, 2023 from 9:20 AM PDT to 9:37 AM PDT, some users encountered issues with messages not sending and channels and threads failing to load.
We determined that a recent indexing change caused a higher than expected level of requests to our database. The resulting high load errors were responsible for the impacted users' inability to load messages and channels.
We immediately reverted this change, which resolved the issue for affected users. We then deployed a fix to prevent this from reoccurring in the future.

entry.title: VPC Connectivity Disruption in NYC3
entry.summary: Aug 17, 01:23 UTC Resolved - Our Engineering team has confirmed full resolution of the issue impacting VPC network connectivity in NYC3. As of 23:58 UTC, users should now be able to place resources correctly into VPC's in NYC3 via API create requests, and VPC connectivity between NYC3 resources should now be restored. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from your Cloud Control Panel. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for any inconvenience. Aug 17, 00:44 UTC Monitoring - The mitigation performed by our Engineering team has been confirmed as resolving customer impact for the issue with VPC's in NYC3. We'll continue to monitor for a short period and will post an update once we confirm this issue is fully resolved. Aug 17, 00:22 UTC Identified - Our Engineering team identified an issue with VPC Connectivity for resources in our NYC3 region. Users creating new resources were not able to place them correctly into VPC's in NYC3 via API create requests. Users also saw network connectivity errors between members of NYC3 VPC's. This issue impacted Droplet-based products like Load Balances and Managed Kubernetes clusters as well, manifesting in various VPC-related errors. Our team was able to mitigate this issue and we're currently monitoring the situation. As of 00:00 UTC, users should see normal VPC behavior in NYC3. We apologize for the disruption and will post another update shortly.

entry.title: App Platform Deployments
entry.summary: Aug 16, 06:05 UTC Resolved - As of 05:55, our Engineering team has resolved the issue impacting Python builds for the App platform. The users will not be experiencing the error "Requested runtime 'python-3.11.3' is not available for this stack (heroku-18)" during the build deployment. We appreciate your patience throughout the process and if you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our Support team for further review. Aug 16, 05:28 UTC Monitoring - As of 05:18 UTC, our Engineering team has deployed a fix to resolve the issue impacting Python builds for App platform. We are actively monitoring the situation to ensure stability and will provide an update once the incident has been fully resolved. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience. Aug 16, 01:30 UTC Update - Our Engineering team continues work on the rollout with the fix for Python builds failing in App Platform. We've identified that a very small number of Apps are impacted by this issue - less than 1% of users have encountered this issue. We will post an update once the rollout completes. Aug 15, 20:27 UTC Identified - Our Engineering team has investigated and identified an issue impacting Python builds for App Platform. Beginning approximately 17:30 UTC, users will see the error "Requested runtime 'python-3.11.3' is not available for this stack (heroku-18)". The team is in the process of rolling out a fix. In the meantime as a workaround, users may update their Apps to use the Ubuntu 22.04-based stack. This stack is in beta, but provides dependency upgrades, and removes support for PHP version 8.0 and earlier. To update, users will need to specify the new stack in the app spec by adding: "features: - buildpack-stack=ubuntu-22" We will post another update once the fix has completed rolling out.

entry.title: FRA1 Network Maintenance Phase 2
entry.summary: Aug 15, 20:59 UTC Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. Aug 15, 18:02 UTC In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. Aug 15, 17:06 UTC Scheduled - Start: 2023-08-15 18:00 UTC End: 2023-08-15 22:00 UTC During the above window, our Networking team will be making changes to our core networking infrastructure to improve performance and scalability in the FRA1 region. This will be the second of the two maintenance activities performed by our team in the region on consecutive days. Expected Impact: These upgrades are designed and tested to be seamless and we do not expect any impact to customer traffic due to this maintenance. If an unexpected issue arises, affected Droplets and Droplet-based services may experience a temporary loss of private connectivity between VPCs. We will endeavor to keep any such impact to a minimum. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this maintenance, please reach out to us by opening up a ticket on your account via https://cloudsupport.digitalocean.com/s/createticket.

entry.title: Container Registry in Multiple Regions
entry.summary: Aug 12, 04:27 UTC Resolved - From 23:16 - 04:00, updates to DigitalOcean Container Registry images were not displayed correctly in the UI (Cloud Control Panel), due to a lapsed internal authorization token. Our Engineering team was able to issue a new token and rolled out the change regionally in order to not disrupt multiple data planes at once. This issue is fully resolved. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our Support team. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience. Aug 12, 03:54 UTC Monitoring - Our Engineering team has confirmed the root cause of the issue with updates to the UI for DigitalOcean Container Registry and a fix is now rolling out regionally. As this rolls out, we expect users to once again be able to see updates to Container Registry images in the UI (Cloud Control Panel). We will post another update once the fix finishes rolling out in all regions. Aug 12, 02:09 UTC Identified - From 23:16 UTC, our Engineering team has identified an issue with DigitalOcean Container Registry and is actively working on a fix. During this time, customers will not be able to see changes on UI for new DOCR Images in multiple regions. We will post an update as soon as additional information is available.

entry.title: Incident: Trouble signing into the desktop app for some Enterprise Grid customers
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
On August 9, 2023 from 9:00 AM PDT to August 10th 2023, 8:00 AM PDT, some Enterprise Grid users experienced a failure to redirect from browser to app during login - focus was moved to the app, but the sign in process did not complete.
We made a change to some logging functions and introduced a fix that mitigated the issue. This fix is permanent and will keep this issue from happening again.

entry.title: Incident: Users may be experiencing issues uploading images and creating canvases.
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
On August 7, 2023, customers may have experienced issues with loading images, creating canvases, and workflow modals being delayed. A small number of customers may have been impacted as early as 5:50 AM PDT, with larger impact seen between 7:03AM PDT to 7:14AM PDT.
We traced the issue to a change that caused our server infrastructure to be overloaded. We rolled back this change, resolving the issue for all impacted users.

entry.title: Increased site latency
entry.summary: Aug 7, 17:35 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Site performance should be back to normal. Aug 7, 16:26 UTC Monitoring - We've stopped a data migration job that is believed to be contributing, and we're now seeing site latency return back to baseline numbers. The site latency should now be back to normal, but we are continuing to monitor. Aug 7, 16:01 UTC Investigating - There is degraded performance across the Rippling application, with certain pages loading slowly. We are investigating the issue.

entry.title: Incident: Some users may be experiencing issues uploading files.
entry.summary: We’ve restored full functionality to file uploads for all impacted users. You may need to reload Slack (Command/Ctrl + Shift + R) in order for this fix to be reflected on your end. We’re sorry for the disruption we brought to your day.

entry.title: Incident: Users may be experiencing issues connecting to Slack
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On August 2, 2023 from 9:01 AM PDT to 11:00 AM PDT, customers may have experienced issues with blurry images in Slack, as well as trouble uploading files. A small percentage of customers may have also experienced errors or slowness when loading channels, sending messages, accessing admin pages, and connecting to Slack.
An issue with a routine database cluster migration inadvertently caused a decrease in capacity. Unfortunately, this coincided with a scheduled job to process a large number of custom status requests, an activity that commonly occurs at the top of each hour. The number of incoming requests exceeded the unintentionally reduced capacity of the database cluster, leading to errors and sluggishness for some actions in Slack. As these requests piled up, other Slack services began to experience issues as well, including a small number of users being unable to connect.
We paused the scheduled custom status job to immediately mitigate the load on the affected database cluster. This resolved some of the errors affecting Slack services. Once we established we had sufficient capacity to handle the scheduled job, we resumed processing the custom status requests, fully restoring normal service for all affected users.
Once the load was balanced and custom status processing had returned to normal, we deployed a fix to correct the issue with the database cluster migration, bringing capacity back to the expected level.

entry.title: Incident with Copilot
entry.summary: Aug 1, 20:28 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Aug 1, 20:12 UTC Investigating - We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Copilot

entry.title: Mobile Push Notifications
entry.summary: Aug 1, 10:10 PDT Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Aug 1, 10:10 PDT Investigating - Between 7/26 and 8/1, Notion experienced an issue which prevented users from receiving push notifications on mobile devices. The issue was resolved today, at approximately 9:45 am PDT.

entry.title: Incident: Channel canvases not loading correctly.
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
From July 26th, 2023 at 8:00AM PDT to July 28th 2023 at 1:00PM PDT some users had trouble loading and editing canvases when accessing them from the channel canvas icon.
We determined this issue was caused by a recent code change related to how canvases persist across sessions. We issued a code update which resolved the issue for all impacted users. To see the fix applied, user impacted users should press Command/Control + R. We are also working on deploying a subsequent code update intended to prevent the issue from reoccurring in the future.

entry.title: Incident Affecting LOS Records API
entry.summary: Jul 28, 11:28 PDT Resolved - [False alarm] This incident was a false alarm—the LOS Records API is working as expected. Apologies for the inconvenience. Jul 28, 10:02 PDT Identified - Starting today (July 28, 2023), we identified an issue affecting the LOS Records API. Records for 180 days from today (beyond Jan 24, 2024) are being ignored, and the dates are marked as unavailable on Airbnb, although requests to set those records are not failing. We are actively working to find the root cause, and mitigate this issue. We will post more information as soon as possible.

Jul 28, 14:51 UTC Update - We are investigating an issue which is causing a delay in the time it takes new commits to show up on a pull request. Jul 28, 14:49 UTC Investigating - We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Pull Requests.

entry.title: Delay in email delivery due to third-party outage
entry.summary: Jul 28, 15:44 UTC Resolved - The incident is now resolved Jul 28, 15:15 UTC Monitoring - The third party provider has resumed service. We are closely monitoring the status of all outgoing emails Jul 28, 15:01 UTC Investigating - Our third-party email delivery provider has been experiencing an intermittent outage since Jul 28th, 7:45 AM PST, causing a delay in notification delivery for all Rippling emails (including password resets). We are investigating this issue with the third-party provider.

entry.title: Issues Affecting Guest Details in Reservation Webhooks
entry.summary: Jul 27, 12:13 PDT Resolved - We have resolved this incident. Jul 27, 00:02 PDT Monitoring - There has been an increase in confirmed reservation notifications not including guest details in full since 2023-07-24. The issue worsened significantly earlier today on 2023-07-27. The root cause has been identified and a fix has been implemented. We are monitoring the situation. We recommend to retrieve the details with GET reservations requests. Apologies for the inconvenience caused.

entry.title: Issues with the employee profile payroll tab
entry.summary: Jul 27, 15:51 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Jul 27, 15:30 UTC Update - A fix has been implemented and product functionality has been restored. Jul 27, 14:58 UTC Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented. Jul 27, 14:52 UTC Update - Users are reporting missing values on the payroll tab in the employee profile. This will be fixed momentarily. This does not impact any processing of payroll. Jul 27, 14:20 UTC Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. Jul 27, 14:18 UTC Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented. Jul 27, 14:13 UTC Investigating - Users are reporting issues with signing in to apps that they use Rippling as the identity provider. Our recommended workaround is to sign in to Rippling first and then navigate to the app using the SSO navigation bar. We are currently investigating this issue.

entry.title: Outage: Slack Systemwide Issues
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On July 27, 2023 between 2:03 AM PDT - 2:59 AM PDT, Slack was experiencing a systemwide issue during which users were not able to send or receive messages across multiple platforms.
Our engineering team identified an issue after a change was made to a service that manages our internal system communication. This resulted in degradation of Slack functionality until the change was reverted which resolved the issue for all users.
We are currently hard at work on scoping measures to prevent this from happening in the future. More information about remediation and prevention steps will be included in an upcoming RCA which you can request by writing into feedback@slack.com.

entry.title: SFO3 Network Maintenance Phase 2
entry.summary:
Jul 27, 03:20 UTC Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. Jul 27, 01:02 UTC In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. Jul 26, 23:08 UTC Scheduled - Start: 2023-07-27 01:00 UTC End: 2023-07-27 05:00 UTC
During the above window, our Networking team will be making changes to our core networking infrastructure to improve performance and scalability in the SFO3 region. This will be the second of the two maintenance activities performed by our team in the region on consecutive days. Expected Impact: These upgrades are designed and tested to be seamless and we do not expect any impact to customer traffic due to this maintenance. If an unexpected issue arises, affected Droplets and Droplet-based services may experience a temporary loss of private connectivity between VPCs. We will endeavour to keep any such impact to a minimum. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this maintenance, please reach out to us by opening up a ticket on your account via https://cloudsupport.digitalocean.com/s/createticket.

We are investigating the cause of the issue and will post an update as we have more information. entry.title: Incident: Email service is failing across Slack
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On July 25th, 2023 from 3:00 PM PDT to 6:00 PM PDT we received reports of existing members unable to invite new members to workspaces. We traced the cause of issue to a recent code change which prevented emails from being sent. This also impacted logins, workspace creation and potentially other email-based processes. We’ve reverted this change, and the issue was resolved for all customers.

entry.title: SFO3 Network Maintenance
entry.summary: Jul 26, 03:45 UTC Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. Jul 26, 01:00 UTC In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. Jul 25, 23:09 UTC Scheduled - Start: 2023-07-26 01:00 UTC End: 2023-07-26 05:00 UTC During the above window, our Networking team will be making changes to our core networking infrastructure to improve performance and scalability in the SFO3 region. This maintenance will occur in two parts on consecutive days and we will send another maintenance notice for the second phase. Expected Impact: These upgrades are designed and tested to be seamless and we do not expect any impact to customer traffic due to this maintenance. If an unexpected issue arises, affected Droplets and Droplet-based services may experience a temporary loss of private connectivity between VPCs. We will endeavor to keep any such impact to a minimum. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this maintenance, please reach out to us by opening up a ticket on your account via https://cloudsupport.digitalocean.com/s/createticket.

entry.title: 500 Error on PUT Pricing Settings API
entry.summary: Jul 25, 13:03 PDT Resolved - We resolved the incident. Please retry any request that failed during the incident, and don't hesitate to contact us if you need support. Jul 25, 11:50 PDT Monitoring - We have deployed a fix for this issue around 11:00 AM (PDT), and are monitoring the results. Jul 25, 09:49 PDT Investigating - We are actively investigating an increased number of 500 errors on the PUT Pricing Settings endpoint. These errors started today (July 25, 2023) around 05:00 AM (PDT). Our engineering teams are working to get everything up and running again, and we will update you with the latest information as soon as possible.

entry.title: 500 Error Across Multiple Endpoints and Support Tools
entry.summary: Jul 24, 15:37 PDT Resolved - We resolved the incident around 03:00 PM (PDT). Please retry any request that failed during the incident, and don't hesitate to contact us if you need support. Jul 24, 14:16 PDT Investigating - We are actively investigating an increased number of 500 errors across multiple endpoints, as well as timeout errors on the Partner Portal. These errors started today (July 24, 2023) around 02:00 PM PDT. Our engineering teams are working to get everything up and running again, and we will update you with the latest information as soon as possible.

entry.title: Incident: Option to unarchive private channels is missing
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
From 2:46 PM PDT to 6:44 PM PDT on July 21, 2023, some users were unable to unarchive channels to which they belonged.
We determined that a recent code change caused this issue. We reverted the code change and the issue was resolved.

entry.title: Incident: Thread search results may be returning as blank for users.
entry.summary: Users should no longer be experiencing any trouble searching threads. Apologies for the trouble today and thank you for your patience.

entry.title: Incident: Users may be experiencing issues loading threads and sending messages.
entry.summary: Users should no longer be experiencing any trouble loading threads or sending messages. Apologies for the trouble today and thank you for your patience.
